citation.article-title: Planifilum yunnanense sp. nov., a thermophilic thermoactinomycete isolated from a hot spring.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Planifilum yunnanense sp. nov.
Planifilum yunnanense (yun.nan.en′se. N.L. neut. adj. Yunnanense referring to Yunnan, the southern Province, P. R. China, where the sample was collected).
Colonies are rough and cream–yellow with radial wrinkles.
Growth occurs at 50–75 °C (optimum growth at 60–70 °C) and pH 6.0–10.0 (optimum growth at pH 8.5).
Casein, glutin and starch are degraded.
Predominant fatty acids are iso-C17 : 0 (27.7 %) and C16 : 0 (22.4 %).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 56.8 mol%.
The type strain, LA5T (=CCTCC AA206002T=KCTC 13052T), was isolated from a hot spring in Yunnan Province, P.
